channel.title: Publish :: DevDocs Navigation Menu Test
channel.description: Publish an integration to the OIN Click here to give feedback about this page Section Notes The Publish section contains all the information needed to submit, test and publish an integration to the Okta Integration Network. About This Page Page ID: 354 Is this a new page?: Existing doc: changes are needed to update the doc and to fit the new IA Target personas: Saas Builder Description: Publish landing page draft: https://www.

item.title: Review the submission checklist
item.description: OIN submission checklist Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 849 Is this a new page?: New doc with new content but also pulling from existing content Target personas: Saas Builder Page type: Concept Content type: Explanation Explanations present a more detailed dive into a single topic compared to Conceptual Overviews. They aim to clarify specific elements of the technology, offering developers practical insights or in-depth clarification on particular points of interest.

item.title: SSO
item.description: Submit a Single Sign-On (SSO) Integration Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 856 Is this a new page?: Existing doc: changes are needed to update the doc and to fit the new IA Target personas: Saas Builder Description: How to submit your SSO integration (including the test process) using the OIN Wizard Page type: Concept Content type: Explanation Explanations present a more detailed dive into a single topic compared to Conceptual Overviews.

item.title: LCM
item.description: Submit a lifecycle management integration Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 392 Is this a new page?: Existing doc: no changes needed to fit the new IA Target personas: Saas Builder Changes to be made: Bring the flow diagram from “Publish an OIN integration” to the top to help give it some direction. Split out the update section to Publish > Update your integration Links to original docs:

item.title: API service
item.description: Submit an API service integration Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 393 Is this a new page?: New doc with new content but also pulling from existing content Target personas: Saas Builder Links to original docs: The bottom of the following doc has content related to submitting an API Service: Build an API service integration: https://developer.okta.com/docs/guides/build-api-integration/main/ https://developer.okta.com/docs/guides/submit-app-overview/ (Submission process for SSO integrations) Page type: Task

item.title: Track your integration’s review status
item.description: Track your integration’s review status Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 886 Is this a new page?: New doc with new content but also pulling from existing content Target personas: Saas Builder Page type: Task Content type: How-to with code A “How-to with code” illustrates how to perform a specific task that involves writing code. The focus is geared towards developers integrating an SDK, API, or another library into their applications.

item.title: Update your integration
item.description: Releasing new versions of your app Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 83 Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Target personas: Saas Builder Why is this here?: At Oktane, the OIN Survey showed several customers citing the following as “Missing info with the OIN Docs”: Missing information from the app providers on their new versions SP Software version info Page type: Navigation

item.title: Find help for OIN issues
item.description: Find help for OIN issues Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Page ID: 668 Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Target personas: Saas Builder Description: The goal of this page is to give links to OIN related education courses, OIN support communites, sites where they need to talk to sales, etc. Why is this here?: Internal workshop: When asked “What prevents developers from being successful on the OIN”, respondents answered: How to ask for and receive help from OKta Links to Okta Education classes Page type: Task
